intro: Craibia brevicaudata subsp. burttii, commonly known as the Burtt's craibia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
